meanings.definition: Unable to be restrained or controlled.
meanings.sent1: The wild horse was incoercible, refusing to be tamed by anyone.
meanings.sent2: The river flowed incoercible, unrestricted by any dam in its path.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous toddler proved to be incoercible, escaping from every attempt to keep him still.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was incoercible, bubbling up uncontrollably at the silly joke.
meanings.sent5: The storm's fury was incoercible, unleashing its power without warning.

meanings.definition: Not able to be confined or confined.
meanings.sent1: The curious cat was incoercible, always finding a way out of its cage.
meanings.sent2: The free spirit of the artist was incoercible, refusing to be limited by any boundaries.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel proved to be incoercible, escaping from every trap set by the gardener.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams were incoercible, soaring beyond the limits of reality.
meanings.sent5: The imagination of a child is incoercible, boundless and unrestricted by logic.
